sample_docs: Home > Affiliated Institutes > Institute of Advanced Integration Technology > Research Center > Laboratory for Intelligent Design and Machine Vision > Introduction Research Laboratory for Intelligent Design and Machine Vision (IDMV) was founded in Feb. 2008. The lab concentrates some edge problems in computer vision and computer graphics domains, especially the 3D vision and 3D modeling techniques and their applications in industries. Professor Charlie C. L. Wang has been appointed as the director and professor SONG Zhan has been appointed as the executive director of the lab since 2012. IDMV has 7 full-time staff members, including one researcher, four engineers, two post-doctor and nine Ph.D. and M.Phil. Students. IDMV has gained several remarkable research achievements since its foundation. Some related research articles have been published in area top journals, such as the IEEE Trans. on PAMI, IEEE Trans. on IE, IEEE Trans. on IP, and CAD, etc. More than 40 patents of invention have been issued or applied in the past four years. The laboratory has received several grants from the NSFC, NSFC-Guangdong, and the CAD Knowledge and Creativities Project etc. IDMV has also founded close corporations with some leading companies in China, such as Huawei and Skyworth, etc. Some of our research works were also reported by the media and news such as CCTV.

Home > Research > Institute of Advanced Integration Technology > Research Center > Laboratory for Human Machine Control Established in 2006, the laboratory is majorly involved with key technologies of human-machine-interface including image processing and computer vision, multimodal human-computer interaction, robotics and application of machine vision in virtual reality alike. Lab director, Dr. Jun Cheng, presided over 30 research projects including national science foundation projects, published over 120 high quality papers in international journals and conference proceedings; besides, he owns 2 US patent, 17 national patents, 14 new utility patents and 40 undergoing national patent applications. Great efforts have been made in application oriented research works and close connection with companies has been established. Three research laboratories are cofounded to commercialize the technologies, namely, virtual sports united lab, internet robotics united lab and service robotics united lab. Two companies, Shenzhen Taishan network Co. ltd and Shenzhen Zhongkeruicheng Co. ltd., both in which SIAT holds technology shares, are established and products are commercialized.
